text.0:
:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Get our fact-checks of the week's most outrageous claims delivered straight to your WhatsApp inbox.

Subscribe in three easy steps:

:link: Click the link https://t.co/0baDsRbvkA
:input_numbers: Save our number
:mobile_phone: Send a message with your name. https://t.co/sEI69zVZv3
text.1:
Applying for a Tala loan through this website WON'T get you the cash you need.

:money_with_wings: The mobile lender shut down its operations in :Tanzania: back in 2019, and the website in question is fake: https://t.co/LqTOaZj9tt
text.2:
An image of a massive, mysterious 'sea monster' on a beach has been ALTERED.

:spouting_whale: The original photo is of a beached whale in :Chile: taken in 2011: https://t.co/NH1yFk8SG9
text.3:
A tweet with images showing genocide in Congo is PARTLY FALSE. 

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: While it's true that there is an ongoing humanitarian crisis, the photos were taken elsewhere and are not of the current situation in the country: https://t.co/1OPqcGRXdu
text.4:
:warning_selector: From a dodgy photo of a 'sea monster' to a fake finance website, our fact-checkers investigated some cunningly crafted false claims this week.

:newspaper: Here are our top stories from the past seven days:
